question: Determine the total valence electrons in 44 grams of CO₂ given its molar mass is 44 g/mol, each molecule contributes exactly three atoms toward atomic enumeration, and each molecule provides 16 valence electrons, requiring derivation of the foundational quantity from these constants before valence electron computation without external data or assumptions.
subject: chemistry
constant_ev: Use molar mass of CO₂ = 44 g/mol in the mole calculation
Assume 3 atoms per CO₂ molecule when calculating the total number of atoms
Use 16 valence electrons per CO₂ molecule (4 from carbon + 12 from two oxygen atoms) when calculating the total number of valence electrons
derived_ev: The molar mass of CO₂ is verified as 44 g/mol using authoritative chemical databases
The number of moles in 44 grams of CO₂ is 1 mole
The total number of atoms (carbon and oxygen combined) in 44 grams of CO₂ is 1.806642228 × 10²⁴ atoms
The number of CO₂ molecules in 44 grams of CO₂ is 6.02214076 × 10²³ molecules
The total number of valence electrons in 44 grams of CO₂ is 9.635425216 × 10²⁴ valence electrons

tier1_result.reasoning: The solver performed the calculation correctly; the expected and solver answers represent the same value with different precision (9.635425216×10²⁴ vs 9.635425×10²⁴), the solver having rounded to 6 significant figures. The relative difference is only 0.00000224%, so the discrepancy is negligible and the answers agree.
